channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ID
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ID

item.title: Report E-2023080131
item.description:
Report E-2023080131

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: GRAND VIEW
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 19, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing sodium carbonate was damaged during transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer floor and asphalt roadway as well as the soil/gravel shoulder. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from The L&R Group (TLR) to remediate the impacted surfaces. Crews placed the damaged 50-gallon drum in an 85-gallon over pack drum for disposal. TLR personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and asphalt and worked them in with hand tools. Crews utilized hand tools to collect the absorbents and impacted soil and gravel from the shoulder and placed in a 30-gallon drum for disposal. All sodium carbonate impacted material was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum and one (1) 30-gallon drum and sent with the truck to the Boise, ID RLC terminal.
